643.name: Russia
643.fact: Russia spans 11 time zones, the most of any nation.

124.name: Canada
124.fact: Canada contains nearly 20% of the world's surface fresh water in its lakes.

840.name: United States
840.fact: The U.S. Interstate Highway System doubles as the world's largest public works project.

156.name: China
156.fact: China operates the world's longest high-speed rail network, stretching over 40,000 km.

076.name: Brazil
076.fact: Brazil's Amazon Basin produces about a fifth of Earth's flowing fresh water.

036.name: Australia
036.fact: Australia's Great Barrier Reef is the largest living structure on the planet.

356.name: India
356.fact: India's Kumbh Mela gathering is visible from space because of its sheer scale.

032.name: Argentina
032.fact: Argentina's Patagonia hosts the advancing Perito Moreno Glacier.

398.name: Kazakhstan
398.fact: Kazakhstan's Baikonur Cosmodrome launched both Sputnik and Yuri Gagarin.

012.name: Algeria
012.fact: Over 80% of Algeria's landmass lies within the Sahara Desert.

180.name: Democratic Republic of the Congo
180.fact: The Congo River in the DRC powers the world's deepest river canyon.

682.name: Saudi Arabia
682.fact: Saudi Arabia built the world's largest desalinated-water network to supply its cities.

484.name: Mexico
484.fact: Mexico City was built over a lake and is slowly sinking each year.

360.name: Indonesia
360.fact: Indonesia straddles the Equator with more than 17,000 islands.

729.name: Sudan
729.fact: Sudan is home to more ancient pyramids than Egypt.

434.name: Libya
434.fact: Libya's Great Man-Made River pumps fossil water from beneath the Sahara.

364.name: Iran
364.fact: Iran's ancient qanat tunnels still deliver water across arid regions today.

496.name: Mongolia
496.fact: Mongolia's vast steppe supports one of the last great nomadic cultures.

604.name: Peru
604.fact: Peru's Andes contain the world's highest commercial navigable lake, Titicaca.

148.name: Chad
148.fact: Chad's Lake Chad has shrunk to a fraction of its 1960 size.

562.name: Niger
562.fact: Niger hosts the Aïr Mountains, a Saharan massif nicknamed Africa's Switzerland.

024.name: Angola
024.fact: Angola's Kalandula Falls drop wider than Niagara.

466.name: Mali
466.fact: Mali's ancient city of Timbuktu once led the Islamic world's scholarship.

170.name: Colombia
170.fact: Colombia holds the world's highest bird species diversity.

231.name: Ethiopia
231.fact: Ethiopia uses a calendar roughly seven years behind the Gregorian system.

068.name: Bolivia
068.fact: Bolivia's Salar de Uyuni becomes the planet's largest natural mirror after rains.

478.name: Mauritania
478.fact: Mauritania's Eye of the Sahara is visible from space as a giant bullseye.

818.name: Egypt
818.fact: Egypt's Nile Delta fans across 240 km of Mediterranean coastline.

834.name: Tanzania
834.fact: Tanzania hosts Africa's highest peak, Mount Kilimanjaro.

566.name: Nigeria
566.fact: Nigeria's Nollywood film industry releases hundreds of movies monthly.

862.name: Venezuela
862.fact: Venezuela's Ángel Falls is the world's highest uninterrupted waterfall.

516.name: Namibia
516.fact: Namibia's Namib Desert dune field is one of the oldest deserts on Earth.

508.name: Mozambique
508.fact: Mozambique's coastline spans 2,500 km along the Indian Ocean.

586.name: Pakistan
586.fact: Pakistan's Karakoram Highway is among the highest paved roads globally.

792.name: Turkey
792.fact: Istanbul, Turkey's largest city, straddles two continents.

152.name: Chile
152.fact: Chile stretches across 38 degrees of latitude, touching almost every climate.

894.name: Zambia
894.fact: Zambia shares Victoria Falls, called Mosi-oa-Tunya, with Zimbabwe.

104.name: Myanmar
104.fact: Myanmar houses the world's largest teak forest reserves.

004.name: Afghanistan
004.fact: Afghanistan's Bamiyan cliffs once held giant Buddha statues carved in the 500s.

728.name: South Sudan
728.fact: South Sudan's Sudd swamp is one of the world's largest wetlands.

706.name: Somalia
706.fact: Somalia has Africa's longest mainland coastline.

140.name: Central African Republic
140.fact: The Central African Republic sits near the geographic heart of Africa.

804.name: Ukraine
804.fact: Ukraine's black soil belt is among the planet's most fertile.

450.name: Madagascar
450.fact: Over 80% of Madagascar's wildlife exists nowhere else on Earth.

072.name: Botswana
072.fact: Botswana's Okavango Delta is a vast inland river that never reaches the sea.

404.name: Kenya
404.fact: Kenya lies on the Equator yet snows cap Mount Kenya seasonally.

250.name: France
250.fact: France's territory spans the globe with overseas departments in four oceans.

887.name: Yemen
887.fact: Yemen's Socotra Island shelters alien-looking dragon blood trees.

764.name: Thailand
764.fact: Thailand is the only Southeast Asian nation never colonized by Europe.

724.name: Spain
724.fact: Spain operates the world's oldest working lighthouse, the Tower of Hercules.

795.name: Turkmenistan
795.fact: Turkmenistan's Darvaza crater has burned continuously for five decades.

120.name: Cameroon
120.fact: Cameroon is nicknamed Africa in miniature for its varied geography.

598.name: Papua New Guinea
598.fact: Papua New Guinea hosts over 800 distinct languages.

752.name: Sweden
752.fact: Sweden rebuilds its iconic ICEHOTEL from river ice every winter.

860.name: Uzbekistan
860.fact: Uzbekistan's Silk Road cities glow with turquoise-tiled madrasas.

504.name: Morocco
504.fact: Morocco's Chefchaouen medina is famed for sky-blue alleys.

368.name: Iraq
368.fact: Iraq's Mesopotamian marshes were restored after being nearly drained in the 1990s.

600.name: Paraguay
600.fact: Paraguay hosts Itaipu Dam, once the world's largest hydropower plant.

716.name: Zimbabwe
716.fact: Zimbabwe's Matobo Hills shelter some of Africa's densest rock art sites.

392.name: Japan
392.fact: Japan has over 5.5 million vending machines serving everything from ramen to umbrellas.

276.name: Germany
276.fact: Germany hosts the world's largest trade fair grounds in Hannover.

178.name: Republic of the Congo
178.fact: The Republic of the Congo protects vast tracts of untouched rainforest.

246.name: Finland
246.fact: Finland boasts more saunas than cars.

704.name: Vietnam
704.fact: Vietnam's Ha Long Bay holds nearly 2,000 limestone islets.

458.name: Malaysia
458.fact: Malaysia's Petronas Towers were the tallest twin towers for almost 20 years.

578.name: Norway
578.fact: Norway generates almost all its electricity from hydropower.

384.name: Côte d'Ivoire
384.fact: Côte d'Ivoire supplies over 40% of the world's cocoa beans.

616.name: Poland
616.fact: Poland's Wieliczka Salt Mine features chapels carved underground.

512.name: Oman
512.fact: Oman built the Middle East's oldest still-operating frankincense port.

380.name: Italy
380.fact: Italy contains more UNESCO World Heritage Sites than any other country.

608.name: Philippines
608.fact: The Philippines is the texting capital of the world, sending billions of SMS daily.

218.name: Ecuador
218.fact: Ecuador's biodiversity includes 10% of the world's known plant species.

854.name: Burkina Faso
854.fact: Burkina Faso's Gourounsi villages glow with painted earthen patterns.

554.name: New Zealand
554.fact: New Zealand's Milford Sound was carved by glaciers into dramatic fjords.

266.name: Gabon
266.fact: Gabon keeps 11% of its land in national parks.

324.name: Guinea
324.fact: Guinea's Fouta Djallon highlands source West Africa's major rivers.

826.name: United Kingdom
826.fact: The UK built the world's first underground railway in 1863.

800.name: Uganda
800.fact: Uganda hosts half of the planet's remaining mountain gorillas.

288.name: Ghana
288.fact: Ghana was the first sub-Saharan African nation to gain independence in 1957.

642.name: Romania
642.fact: Romania's Palace of Parliament is the world's heaviest building.

418.name: Laos
418.fact: Laos is the only landlocked nation in Southeast Asia.

328.name: Guyana
328.fact: Guyana's Kaieteur Falls drops five times higher than Niagara.

112.name: Belarus
112.fact: Belarus is blanketed by forests covering 40% of its territory.

417.name: Kyrgyzstan
417.fact: Kyrgyzstan's Issyk-Kul Lake never freezes despite alpine winters.

686.name: Senegal
686.fact: Senegal hosts the Pink Lake, colored by salt-loving algae.

760.name: Syria
760.fact: Syria's ancient city of Palmyra once linked Rome to Persia by caravan.

116.name: Cambodia
116.fact: Cambodia's Angkor Wat is the largest religious monument on Earth.

858.name: Uruguay
858.fact: Uruguay pioneered nationwide free laptops for schoolchildren.

788.name: Tunisia
788.fact: Tunisia's Star Wars film sets still stand in the Sahara.

740.name: Suriname
740.fact: Suriname is the only nation outside Europe with Dutch as the official language.

524.name: Nepal
524.fact: Nepal is home to eight of the world's ten tallest mountains.

050.name: Bangladesh
050.fact: Bangladesh exports more jute fiber than any other country.

762.name: Tajikistan
762.fact: Tajikistan is dominated by the Pamir Mountains, called the Roof of the World.

300.name: Greece
300.fact: Greece's coastline stretches longer than mainland Africa's despite its size.

558.name: Nicaragua
558.fact: Nicaragua's Lake Nicaragua contains freshwater sharks.

232.name: Eritrea
232.fact: Eritrea's capital Asmara preserves Art Deco architecture from the 1930s.

408.name: North Korea
408.fact: North Korea's Rungrado 1st of May Stadium seats 114,000 spectators.

454.name: Malawi
454.fact: Malawi's Lake Malawi hosts more fish species than any other lake.

204.name: Benin
204.fact: Benin birthed the Kingdom of Dahomey, famed for its women warriors.

340.name: Honduras
340.fact: Honduras's Bay Islands sit atop the second-longest barrier reef.

430.name: Liberia
430.fact: Liberia's capital Monrovia is named after U.S. President James Monroe.

100.name: Bulgaria
100.fact: Bulgaria produces the famed rose oil used in Parisian perfumes.

192.name: Cuba
192.fact: Cuba's Old Havana holds one of the best-preserved Spanish colonial cores.

320.name: Guatemala
320.fact: Guatemala's Tikal temples once led the Maya world.

352.name: Iceland
352.fact: Iceland generates almost 100% of its electricity from renewable sources.

410.name: South Korea
410.fact: South Korea has the world's fastest average internet speeds.

348.name: Hungary
348.fact: Hungary's Budapest sits atop more than 120 thermal springs.

620.name: Portugal
620.fact: Portugal's coastline inspired explorers who mapped the globe.

400.name: Jordan
400.fact: Jordan's Petra was carved into rose-red cliffs over 2,000 years ago.

031.name: Azerbaijan
031.fact: Azerbaijan's capital Baku is famed for natural gas flames that burn from the ground.

040.name: Austria
040.fact: Austria's Alpine Grossglockner High Alpine Road climbs above 2,500 meters.
